Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: After spending nearly $30k on CHIPS and having to watch the devs try to keep the chain running a year later, I've held off on spending any more on other Komodo side projects.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: The devs aren't struggling, miners just need to mine.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: chips will be fine, have hope

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: Been a year. That hope is taking a while to come. The dollar value of the coin isn't what concerns me. I just want it to reliably work.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: It was said from the beginning that chips wouldn't be used for gambling anytime soon as it all had to be developed still.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: Mine it. The network is fine then.

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: I'm not a miner and telling me to be one isn't the fix I'm looking for. I knew it would be a long while before CHIPS would have a use outside of just sending coins but now you can hardly do that. Regardless, all my investment is going toward projects outside of Komodo until I see CHIPS working properly again.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: If there was a real issue that needed fixing I'd agree with you. People just need to care to mine it...

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: No one wants the small block rewards, and just think someone else will mine it for them..

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: decentralized networks require people to come together and participate in keeping it going. Its not a dev issue, its a community/miner problem

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: Then that problem should have been thought of before it came to be. I'm the guy that buys the coins from the miners so I don't have to go through the trouble of setting up miners myself. I am part of the crowd that gives a reason why anyone would mine a coin. I am not about to start renting or buying miners for one coin when I haven't had to in over four years. If it comes to the point that I have to be the one to mine it, then you might well mark the coin up for dead.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: How can one predict that miners won't want to mine? If you don't want to, try to find others that might want to. I am mining myself trying to help. Others can as well.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: I'm just saying decentralized coins and such require the community to do things. We can't just complain it doesn't work and the devs should fix it..

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: If you own CHIPS then you probably have a financial interest in making sure the network stays healthy

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: Even I thought of the blocks giving out little reward a year later and so expected the devs to know that as well and had a plan for it. There wasn't a plan until recently. I convince a few big investors as well to buy into chips so I think I helped at the start at least.

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: I've been in crypto too long to argue this. I'll just write off the investment as a lose and move on. I will still continue to invest with Komodo but any side project is off the books.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: hah goodluck

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: thanks for your support

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CHIPS core code is still being developed, as long as the network is there when the core code is ready, that is what is important
